DOC.criteria: Healthy male and/or female subject age 18 55 year , inclusive ( Healthy define clinically relevant abnormality identify detailed medical history , full physical examination , include blood pressure pulse rate measurement , 12 lead ECG clinical laboratory test ) . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 17.5 30.5 kg/m2 ; total body weight > 50 kg ( 110 lb ) . An informed consent document sign date subject legally acceptable representative . Subjects willing able comply schedule visit , treatment plan , laboratory test , study procedure . Evidence history clinically significant hematological , renal , endocrine , pulmonary , gastrointestinal , cardiovascular , hepatic , psychiatric , neurologic , allergic disease ( include drug allergy , exclude untreated , asymptomatic , seasonal allergy time dose ) . History febrile illness within 5 day prior first dose . Treatment azithromycin within past 30 day chloroquine within past 45 day . Known immediate family history prolong QT Syndrome , serious ventricular arrhythmia , sudden cardiac death . `` Immediate '' consider `` first degree '' . Known allergy macrolide antibiotic ( eg , erythromycin , clarithromycin , azithromycin ) chloroquine ( 4 aminoquinolines ) severe allergic reaction drug past ( eg , difficulty breathing , anaphylaxis ) . History intolerance azithromycin chloroquine .
